intro: Corispermum squarrosum subsp. monticola, commonly known as the mountain corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions.
